ASK.question: Is this person able to give or do what I want?
Is getting my objective more important than my relationship with this person?
Will asking help me feel competent and self-respecting?
Is the person required by law or moral code to do or give me what I want?
Am I responsibile for telling the person what to do?
Is what I want appropriate for this relationship?  (Is it right to ask for what I want?)
Is asking important to a long-term goal?
Do I give as much as I get with this person?
Do I know what I want and have the facts I need to support my request?
Is this a good time to ask?  (Is the person in the right mood?)

SAY_NO.question: Can I give the person what is wanted?
Is my relationship more important than saying no?
Will saying no make me feel bad about myself?
Am I required by law or moral code to give or do what is wanted, or does saying no violate this person's rights?
Is the other person responsible for telling me what to do?
Is what the person is requesting of me appropriate to my relationship with this person?
In the long term, will I regret saying no?
Do I owe this person a favor?  (Does the person do a lot for me?)
Do I know what I am saying no to?  (Is the other person clear about what is being asked for?)
Should I wait a while before saying no?  (e.g. Am I in a bad mood right now?)
